fokus 0.0.9010
  • Reference

Determine whether ballot type includes an election

Source: R/fokus.gen.R
has_election.Rd

Determines whether or not the ballot for the specified canton at the specified date on the specified political level(s) includes an election of the specified election procedure(s).

has_election(
  ballot_date = ballot_dates,
  lvls = c("cantonal", "federal"),
  canton = cantons,
  prcds = c("proportional", "majoritarian")
)

Arguments

ballot_date

A valid FOKUS-covered cantonal ballot date. One of

  • "2018-09-23"

  • "2018-11-25"

  • "2019-10-20"

  • "2020-09-27"

  • "2020-10-18"
lvls

Political level(s). One or more of

  • "cantonal"

  • "federal"
canton

A valid FOKUS canton. One of

  • "aargau"
prcds

Election procedure(s). One or more of

  • "proportional"

  • "majoritarian"

Value

A logical scalar.

Details

Note that if more than one lvls/prcds are provided (the default), they are interpreted according to the rules of logical disjunction, i.e. TRUE is returned if any lvls/prcds are included in the specified ballot.

For logical conjunction, use e.g. has_election(lvls = "cantonal") && has_election(lvls = "federal").

See also

Other fundamental predicate functions ballot_types(), ballot_type(), has_lvl(), has_referendum(), n_elections(), n_proposals()

Examples

fokus::has_election(ballot_date = "2018-09-23",
                    canton = "aargau")

#> [1] FALSE
